main.name: Joy Chen
main.description: software developer. I'm a current UNC Coding Bootcamp student who will finish in August 2020. I use ReactJS and JavaScript to develop applications. This website serves as a testimony to my skills
main.bio: I graduated from UNC-Chapel Hill in May 2017 and immediately joined the Durham Police Department while I figured out what I wanted to do. After almost three years on the force, I decided to I wanted to be a software developer. Please feel free to email me at joychen5069@gmail.com. I look forward to hearing from you!
main.contactmessage: If you're interested in working with me, send me a message down below and I'll get back to you as soon as possible. I look forward to hearing from you!

resume.skillmessage: Just a quick screenshot of my abilities!

education.degree: BA in Peace, War, and Defense
education.description: A four year degree in the studies of national and international security and relations with a strong focus in modern warfare.

work.title: Full-Stack Developer
work.description: This application allows you to find a book club to join depending on your reading interests. The project is powered by JavaScript, AJAX API calls, NodeJS, and SQL. Feel free to checkout the demo

work.title: Full-Stack Developer
work.description: This project allows the user to choose a cuisine and alcohol type to find a food pairing. The website will give you a completed picture of what the meal and drink should look like, the ingredient list, and the instructions on how to make the meal. The Date Night application was developed using HTML5, CSS, Javascript, JQuery, Materialize.
